uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.jdbc.filter

Interface JoinFilter<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - type of object selected
    All Superinterfaces:
    BaseFilter<T>, MultiTableFilter, Targetted<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AndFilter, BaseCombineFilter, BaseSQLCombineFilter, ConstJoinerFilter, HistoryFactory.HistoryFilter, IndexedLinkManager.LinkFilter, IndexedLinkManager.SQLLinkFilter, Joiner, JoinerFilter, LinkHistorySQLFilter, LogFactory.DateFilter, LogFactory.ItemDateFilter, LogFactory.TypeFilter, SQLAndFilter, SQLFormFilter, SQLOrFilter, TupleFactory.TupleAndFilter, WildCardReferenceFilter, WtmpManager.DateFilter

    public interface JoinFilter<T>
extends BaseFilter<T>, MultiTableFilter
    Interface for filters that add an explicit join clause. The intention here is to filter entries from the primary tables based on the data it points to The filter clauses on the remote object have to be done entirely in SQL because we are only returning objects from the primary table. Any condition clause will need to qualify the field names This is added in to the source clause by the FilterReader.

    • Method Detail

      • addJoin

        void addJoin(java.util.Set<Repository> tables,
             java.lang.StringBuilder join_clause,
             java.util.Set<LinkClause> additions)
        add join clause to add to query. Each Repository should only be joined to once. A table may be joined to multiple times if via a Repository with an alias. If the Repository being joined to is already present the join_clause is left unchanged but the LinkClause is added to the additions list.
        Parameters:
        tables - Set of Repositorys in join (updated)
        join_clause - Query join clause (modified)
        additions - Additional LinkClauses to add to select
